early.description: Born on a space station orbiting a mining planet, you were exposed to zero-gravity environments from an early age.
At age ten, you disassembled and reassembled a malfunctioning maintenance bot, impressing the station's engineers.
You began an apprenticeship under a seasoned orbital mechanic, learning the basics of space machinery.
A close call during an external hull repair taught you the importance of safety protocols.
You developed a fascination with the complex systems that keep space stations operational.
Witnessing a catastrophic equipment failure instilled in you a meticulous attention to detail.
You modified your personal tools for better efficiency, showcasing your innovative spirit.
An encounter with a veteran astronaut inspired you to aim higher in your career aspirations.
You repaired a critical life-support system under pressure, earning commendation from station leadership.
A malfunction in your EVA suit during a spacewalk left you stranded temporarily, instilling a deep-seated fear of isolation.
You began studying advanced engineering texts, further enhancing your technical knowledge.
An accident caused by a colleague's negligence taught you the importance of teamwork and communication.
You discovered a flaw in the station's structural design, preventing a potential disaster.
A mysterious signal intercepted during maintenance piqued your curiosity about what lies beyond.
You customized a drone to assist in repairs, increasing efficiency and safety.
An illness due to radiation exposure made you more cautious about the hazards of space.
You formed a bond with a fellow mechanic, sharing knowledge and experiences.

mid.description: You were promoted to lead mechanic, overseeing critical repairs and maintenance tasks.
A collision with space debris required you to perform emergency repairs under extreme conditions.
You designed a new component that improved the station's energy efficiency.
An encounter with a rogue AI system forced you to outsmart it to regain control.
You began mentoring junior mechanics, passing on your expertise and safety protocols.
A malfunction during a repair mission led to the loss of a colleague, causing you to question your career.
You discovered corruption in the supply chain, leading to equipment shortages and unsafe working conditions.
An opportunity to transfer to a cutting-edge research station arose, challenging your loyalty.
You developed a rivalry with another lead mechanic, pushing both of you to excel but creating tension.
An EVA mission exposed you to an unknown substance, leading to unexplained side effects.
You led a team to retrofit outdated systems, modernizing the station's operations.
A critical component failure forced you to improvise a solution with limited resources.
You began experiencing recurring nightmares related to your work, affecting your performance.
An encounter with a derelict spacecraft revealed technologies beyond your understanding.
You started questioning the corporation's practices after discovering unethical disposal of hazardous materials.
A romantic relationship with a crew member complicated your professional responsibilities.
You suffered a physical injury that required rehabilitation, testing your resilience.

late.description: Promoted to chief engineer, you now oversee all mechanical operations on the station.
A catastrophic event required you to coordinate evacuation procedures, putting lives in your hands.
You discovered a corporate cover-up regarding structural flaws in the station's design.
A mysterious illness spread among the crew, and you suspected contamination from maintenance work.
You were offered a position on a deep-space vessel, challenging your comfort zone.
An AI system you helped develop began exhibiting unpredictable behavior.
Faced with budget cuts, you had to make tough decisions about resource allocation, impacting safety.
You began to suffer from a degenerative condition due to prolonged exposure to space radiation.
A faction within the crew advocated for independence from corporate control, seeking your support.
You mentored a prodigy who might one day surpass you, prompting reflections on your legacy.
An incident led to you being falsely accused of negligence, threatening your career.
You discovered alien technology integrated into the station's systems without crew knowledge.
A personal tragedy on Earth affected your focus, causing you to reconsider your path.
You authored a comprehensive manual on orbital mechanics, solidifying your expertise.
An opportunity to retire presented itself, but leaving space life proved more difficult than expected.
You faced a moral dilemma when ordered to prioritize corporate interests over crew safety.
An external threat, such as pirates or a rival corporation, forced you to defend the station using your technical skills.
